intro: Drimiopsis rosea, commonly known as the pink drimiopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking pinkish-white flowers. The plant features strap-like, dark green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It produces bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring, adding ornamental value to gardens. Drimiopsis rosea is relatively low maintenance and thrives in well-drained soil and bright, indirect light.
